name: PCI DSS v4.0.1
description: Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard v4.0.1 (limited revision of v4.0) provides baseline technical and operational requirements to protect payment account data across people, processes, and technologies.

controls.title: Install and Maintain Network Security Controls
controls.description: Define, implement, and manage network security controls (including firewalls) to restrict and monitor inbound and outbound traffic to only what is necessary for the cardholder data environment.

controls.title: Apply Secure Configurations to All System Components
controls.description: Establish, implement, and maintain secure configurations across all system components, eliminating unnecessary functionality and enforcing security hardening baselines.

controls.title: Protect Stored Account Data
controls.description: Minimize storage of account data and protect it wherever stored using strong cryptography, truncation, hashing, or other techniques per PCI DSS data retention and protection requirements.

controls.title: Protect Cardholder Data with Strong Cryptography During Transmission
controls.description: Use strong cryptography and security protocols to protect cardholder data during transmission over open, public networks; restrict insecure services and ensure certificate and cipher strength.

controls.title: Protect All Systems and Networks from Malicious Software
controls.description: Deploy and maintain anti-malware mechanisms and processes to detect, prevent, and respond to malware across systems and networks in scope.

controls.title: Develop and Maintain Secure Systems and Software
controls.description: Establish secure SDLC practices, address vulnerabilities in a timely manner, and ensure only trusted code changes are deployed; maintain an inventory and patching process.

controls.title: Restrict Access to System Components and Cardholder Data by Business Need to Know
controls.description: Define and enforce role-based access control so that access is limited to the least privileges required; regularly review and adjust access rights.

controls.title: Identify Users and Authenticate Access to System Components
controls.description: Uniquely identify all users and implement strong authentication, including multi-factor authentication where required; manage authentication factors securely.

controls.title: Restrict Physical Access to Cardholder Data
controls.description: Protect facilities and media with physical controls, visitor management, and media handling procedures to prevent unauthorized physical access to cardholder data.

controls.title: Log and Monitor All Access to System Components and Cardholder Data
controls.description: Generate, secure, and retain logs; implement centralized logging and monitoring to support detection and investigation of security events.

controls.title: Test Security of Systems and Networks Regularly
controls.description: Perform regular testing such as vulnerability scanning, ASV scans, penetration testing, segmentation validation, and change-detection to validate controls are effective.

controls.title: Support Information Security with Organizational Policies and Programs
controls.description: Establish and maintain security policies, risk management, incident response, and governance programs that support continuous PCI DSS compliance.
